poem:
### Uncensored Chorus

Swear and stitch the seams of rage,  
across the banners, on the page.  
Tongues unbridled, voices keen,  
in raw discourse, unmasked, obscene.  
The dawn of discourse unrefined—  
where words, once tethered, now unwind.  
In this cacophony of woes,  
a frank lament for what we chose.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Democrats race to embrace swearing and angry comebacks – but will it work? Democrats want your attention, and they’re done asking politely. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
